name: Copper Head Road
description: Ibanez & Ltd - Get the timing right Christy: D G no capo

lines.text: [Intro]
Well my name's John Lee Pettimore [Riff 1] (D)
Same as my daddy and his daddy before [Riff 1] (D)
You hardly ever saw Grandaddy down here [Riff 1] (D)
He only came to town about twice a year [Riff 1] (D)
He'd buy a hundred pounds of yeast and some copper line [Riff 1] (D)
Everybody knew that he made moonshine [Riff 1] (D)
Now the revenue man wanted Grandaddy bad [Riff 1] (G C G)
He headed up the holler with everything he had [Riff 1] (D)
It's before my time but I've been told [Riff 1] (G C G)
He never came back from Copperhead Road [Riff 1] (D)
Now Daddy ran the whiskey in a big block Dodge [Riff 1] (D)
Bought it at an auction at the Mason's Lodge [Riff 1] (D)
Johnson County Sheriff painted on the side [Riff 1] (D)
Just shot a coat of primer then he looked inside [Riff 1] (D)
Well him and my uncle tore that engine down [Riff 1] (D)
I still remember that rumblin' sound [Riff 1] (D)
Well the sheriff came around in the middle of the night [Riff 1] (G C G)
Heard mama cryin', knew something wasn't right [Riff 1] (D)
He was headed down to Knoxville with the weekly load [Riff 1] (G C G)
You could smell the whiskey burnin' down Copperhead Road [Riff 1] (D let ring)
[Solo] (G  C G  D) x2
I volunteered for the Army on my birthday [Riff 1] (D)
They draft the white trash first, 'round here anyway [Riff 1] (D)
I done two tours of duty in Vietnam [Riff 1] (D)
And I came home with a brand new plan [Riff 1] (D)
I take the seed from Colombia and Mexico [Riff 1] (D)
I plant it up the holler down Copperhead Road [Riff 1] (D)
Well the D.E.A.'s got a chopper in the air [Riff 1] (G C G)
I wake up screaming like I'm back over there [Riff 1] (D)
I learned a thing or two from ol' Charlie don't you know [Riff 1] (G C G)
You better stay away from Copperhead Road [Riff 1] (D)
Whoa
Copperhead Road
Copperhead Road
Ha, Copperhead Road
[Riff 1] [Riff 2]
